79482E902B884961984D5E050FF2F491.description:
Analyze and evaluate the impact of a
musician or musical group on the beliefs, values, and
behaviors of a society.

3C4FE81536CB492387F7DE7A50B40AF9.description:
As self-directed learners, describe
influences and interactions between music and
other common core subjects, including the arts,
through creating, performing, or responding to
music.

FE506CB231174D6785EB651B9C474CC4.description:
As self-directed learners, connect music to
other people’s personal life experiences, when
creating, performing, or responding to music.

807C4BE56C794E5D9941F7885BDF730E.description:
As self-directed learners, make
connections between music and other personal,
societal, cultural, historical, political, and ethical
ways of communication, through creating,
performing, or responding to music.

2C923DAD864849A78749522543534A39.description:
Describe influences and interactions among
music, dance, theatre, visual arts, media arts, and
other disciplines, citing research.

EFCA5A3DD4DC46C5B3E1EAA28DE389AB.description:
Describe and analyze factors that impact
the roles of music in the lives of people, citing
research.

143EA8FF170B4FCF920307442BCA9026.description:
Describe, justify and explain how music
functions as a form of personal, societal, cultural,
historical, political, and ethical communication and
expression, citing musical characteristics and
research.

B7234257245540ED93EF911F168000EF.description:
Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical
context to deepen understanding.

8609913C5F594E86BBAFE32C3D192114.description:
Understand and connect the learning
gained in school with music skills and experiences
gained both inside and outside the classroom and
school environment, including after-school
programs, community music-making, and
extracurricular opportunities.

0378EBFF50AF45C98C652FF4F94F313E.description:
Identify and justify personal and cultural
influences as well as creative preferences in
creating, performing, and responding to music.

1F7C0A5BD965467DB0F998A4DF149529.description:
Describe how interests, experiences,
knowledge, and skills relate to personal choices and
musical intentions when creating, performing, and
responding to music.

E206AEE72FE1431DB0C3E044CEC66EFE.description: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.

540C01FAA3CB42C28EDCAC536E571A85.description:
Choose a varied repertoire of music, and
document comparisons and contrasts between the
different pieces of music.

77D734B3BC7D41458FA9FCB65F5EF59E.description:
Engage appropriately as an active listener
in formal and informal settings, paying attention to
audience etiquette appropriate to the genre of
music.

1E13CE3DDFC04464ACCBB3A52676C2B2.description:
Choose pieces of music or musical
performances from both familiar and unfamiliar
styles, and evaluate the quality according to selfdeveloped criteria. Clearly communicate a point of
view using appropriate musical vocabulary, citing
evidence based on the criteria, personal choices,
research, and understanding of contexts.

B7BF217325054A1D91FA59019F1625A8.description:
Develop and justify personal evaluation of
music, programs of music, and performances, using
appropriate musical vocabulary.

E9FF625DBC8748B4B1CA0870E0039F59.description: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

521A5245CBBB475DB09F52249B250FAA.description:
Analyze and respond to music through
personal interpretation, justifying musical choices by
defining and defending creative intent.

841AD60C6438407895AC8389151D74CB.description:
Analyze information about the structure,
musical elements, context, and observed
performances of a piece of music in order to develop
a personal interpretation. Justify artistic choices.

D633F2C5AB7845D0B09FB8F51954A5CE.description:
Analyze interpretations of the creative
intent and meaning of musical works, citing as
evidence the treatment of the elements of music,
contexts, compositional techniques, and research.

11D4B63E72DC434083B81E57305F22AD.description: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

65F4971E79F1446D844AC41DF30D1AD6.description:
As self-directed learners, use analytical
evidence to support and communicate the
importance of structure, musical elements, and
context when listening to music.

26F59157559347C0B77A3AA9DA4BA621.description:
Select a piece of music and analyze the
musical elements as well as the context of the piece.
Explain how the analysis informs and enhances a
personal response to the music.

FEA8CAF71F3F41918C42CF754B60E366.description:
Describe how the analysis of structures and
contexts (social, cultural, and historical) inform the
response to a variety of music selected for study.

B47999DDAF2448088F47A2B9BB8CC268.description:
Use research and self-developed criteria to
justify choices made when selecting music, citing
knowledge of the music including its purpose and
context.

35FB802BBDBE4CEC95753062F84C1CD1.description:
Choose a varied repertoire of music for
performance by applying knowledge of time, place,
and culture and determine readiness of music for
public performance.

EF91805637B14FB8A28AE5A00FF5AE5F.description:
Interact effectively with the audience and
other performers to convey the artistic purpose of
the piece as well as intended interpretation. Reflect
with the listeners in discussion or other activity
appropriate to the context.

6A2F2DED6FA5480DBB47245ED2B1ADB3.description:
Perform a varied repertoire of music with
artistic purpose, demonstrating technical mastery.

C27BDA0F3B6140519E0F064D4ECB0286.description:
Determine and demonstrate performance
decorum appropriate to the context.

077DD3E904C1474D80DFA82C190DFFE6.description:
Communicate purpose through music
performance, paying attention to accuracy,
interpretation, composer’s intent, and cultural
authenticity.

A3D986AA109B4E39BCC0C55CD93D3105.description: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

ED7BCDB7850946F19A95B223B6E19604.description:
As self-directed learners, manage goals and
time with flexibility, to address newly identified
challenges, in order to improve quality of musical
experience for performers and listeners.

A54B9F16512E4476B76F1EEA90515F36.description:
Apply feedback to improve and refine
music in rehearsal.

7C726F89BE9C408182865CF1B75F6651.description:
As self-directed learners, identify
performance challenges and develop strategies
collaboratively to improve performance quality,
technical accuracy and artistic purpose.

1E26696E977045D5ADEA31B56F3217AA.description:
Develop, apply, and refine appropriate
rehearsal strategies to determine rehearsal
practices, areas of refinement, and readiness of
performance within a varied repertoire and within
diverse ensembles.

D05F3671F198410AA4C4970230FD415C.description: Develop and refine artistic work for presentation.

52741BD8FF704651A92EB5A02C47A634.description:
Read from iconic notation, standard
notation, or alternative notation systems in
preparation for performance, justifying and
supporting their use in appropriate contexts.

C36FD46AC0E840BAA5DEEA064B36ED4C.description:
Support and justify the use of artistic
qualities when interpreting music for performance,
including attention to composer’s intent.

F992564A6169412DAB1377D634B3DBC3.description:
Identify and summarize how the
consideration of musical contexts informs and
influences music selected for performance.

37A3CF921E9348F699D239659092B753.description:
As independent learners, select a piece of
music to read, analyze, and perform with attention
to composer’s creative intent. Justify and support
performance decisions.

AE3C41BA732448F696ABE9FC43B82819.description:
Read and perform from iconic and/or
standard notation, justifying and supporting
appropriate context for different notation systems.

0CA0DFA7D4034CABA6EFD1490171EDD2.description:
Describe and explain how creative intent is
communicated through interpretation in a variety of
musical styles, contexts and genres, including
expressive aspects and musical elements.

66241F3913D9492F948147618E8719EB.description:
Describe and analyze performance
decisions made when presenting music in an
appropriate context, including attention to
composer’s intent.

EA7487EE6DAB45F1AE36C68FFB29D098.description:
Apply criteria to determine the selection of
music for performances based on purpose, context,
technical skills, theoretical characteristics, and
artistic qualities.

522FA4F32FA94EAB990EFA2B0B00D8F2.description: Analyze, interpret, and select artistic work for presentation.

590F7A5E186048C8BC1724E76D9634FB.description:
Present a performance-ready version and
clearly support judgments and decisions made
during the creative process, including refinement,
using appropriate technology as available.

8D2C0576CE124ECE901665451A29477E.description:
Incorporate refinements to personal
musical ideas through analysis and implementation
of feedback.

F8A22AF5D898474A80B9C6D97EF0A2E7.description:
Evaluate and refine personal musical ideas
in response to feedback and document revisions.

632557447845469D8115A02504641055.description:
Present a performance-ready version of
personal musical ideas demonstrating an advancing
level of craft and artistic purpose.

2A974A0803454C40B343567D20F03B89.description:
Support rationale for refinements to
personal musical ideas and describe how the
inferred musical purpose is addressed.

580F09DF33B1479A9F0A5C121CC3AE07.description:
Develop and apply criteria (including
elements of context and intent) to evaluate and
summarize refinements to personal musical ideas.

A37E3522CC104D238FEEB6B00C31EE95.description:
Apply tools, which may include standard
notation, iconic notation, or recording technology,
to notate or record developed musical ideas. Craft
and present a composer’s statement that clearly
summarizes and supports creative and conceptual
choices.

15CCF7E0FFED48DC97711F27F27BCC76.description:
Use a variety of media and methods,
including available technology, to develop, present,
explain, and document musical works with
connections to context and artistic purpose.

2A36BF438A58418B93818D0934790F63.description: Organize and develop artistic ideas and work.

1A60B92A960E4217A9390E402DAF5094.description:
Create music with well-developed melodic,
rhythmic, dynamic, and formal elements, including
complex harmony, in response to artistic stimuli, using
appropriate technology as available.

7588CD1611EA485082451EA774B379E6.description:
As both a self-directed learner and as a
collaborator with others, create musical works that
clearly communicate personal, cultural, or historical
experience, using appropriate technology as available.

FDC0D75BCDEB40C78AF189D6499D4870.description:
Conceptualize and generate musical works for
varied contexts, and artistic purposes with advancing
use of compositional techniques, including effective
use of available technology.

55D92300867D4586BCC39582DFB30829.description: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.
